sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: King Charles III's visit to France has been postponed due to continued strikes and protests against Macron's pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: More than 400 people were arrested across France on Thursday during protests against the government's unpopular pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: King Charles III has postponed his visit to France, the first of the sovereign abroad, due to continued strikes and violent protests against the pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The King of the United Kingdom was supposed to arrive in Paris on Sunday and stay in the country until Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But the Elysee has announced the postponement due to a new day of national mobilisation planned for next Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thursday marked the ninth day of demonstrations against the pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In total, around 500 officers have been injured and the same amount of people arrested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mountains of uncollected rubbish has been piling up on the streets of Paris while street fires illuminate the city at night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The decision has been made by the French and British governments and the trip is set to be rescheduled as soon as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 400 people were arrested in France after a ninth general strike against the country's pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: One of them was an 18-year-old student whose father says he was demonstrating peacefully. He was in the procession with his high school friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And there was this super violent charge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Some of the protesters' relatives and friends have to announce their detention, calling it arbitrary and unjustified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Over 400 people have been detained across France on Thursday following demonstrations that have turned violent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And many remain in custody today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: What you see behind me is friends and family members of people who are detained here in Paris' 17th district.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Many have come here in the early hours of Friday to demand their loved ones release and saying that what's happening here in this country is very worrying, that the government is using the police against its own people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's going to be interesting to see what happens in the coming days, but tensions are very high with government officials multiplying statements today conveying their disappointment at this turn of events.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Clearly, the government was expecting protests to die down following the adoption of that controversial reform of the pension system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But that is not what's been happening. Protesters yesterday, more than three million people in the streets of France, according to unions, saying that they're going to continue their fight until the government drops this reform and have called for another major day of action on Tuesday. But we're also expecting more of these informal gatherings to continue over the next few days over the next few evenings and therefore more tension and more arrests. Annelies Borges in Paris for Euronews.
